page.title: 20PROJECTED PLANS FOR FAIRFORD
page.content: A recent review of the public property, facilities and a questionnaire to all inhabitants is currently under consideration for a future town structure. To reconcile the practical and economic factors with the ideal of the majority the immediate plans are for a new Primary School to be built close to Farmor's School on the north-east of the town; a new Police Station and Library to be built on the Primary School site with conversions of the Victorian Infant School and Police Station and Magistrates Court. Allotment gardens in Quenington Rd., rented from the District Council, will have to be vacated and a new site is being sought in Horcott. A weekly street market is planned for l986 and would revive ancient trading traditions which date back to the l2th century.
